SENT.plain: Focal ischaemia was produced experimentally in Macaca radiata monkeys by occlusion of middle cerebral artery (MCA)
There was a lowering of the dopamine (DA) content of basal ganglia after 4 and 12 h of occlusion
DA content was restored to normal in basal ganglia after restoration of blood flow
With the progress of time the DA content was increased above that of sham controls
Changes were also observed in the non-occluded left basal ganglia
The homovanillic acid (HVA) content was decreased significantly at 12 h after occlusion
After the onset of reflow, the HVA content of the right basal ganglia was higher than that of sham controls
The 3,4 dihydroxyphenylacetic acid (DOPAC) content of right basal ganglia was significantly decreased after 12 h occlusion
Reflow restored the level of DOPAC to normal within 1 h after removal of clip
Discrete changes were also observed in the left basal ganglia at some of the time intervals
